ci_support_linux_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- condaforge/linux-anvil-comp7
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.6.* *_cpython

about.description:
Smatch is an evaluation tool for AMR (Abstract Meaning Representation). It
computes the Smatch score (defined below) of two AMR graphs in terms of
their matching triples (edges) by finding a variable (node) mapping that
maximizes the count, M, of matching triples

Smatch is an evaluation tool for AMR (Abstract Meaning Representation). It
computes the Smatch score (defined below) of two AMR graphs in terms of
their matching triples (edges) by finding a variable (node) mapping that
maximizes the count, M, of matching triples

name: smatch
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "smatch" %}
{% set version = "1.0.4" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 33f4401dd0c23517fb64872bb4981e081a8a58a7bb1f34a4bf04243de30e19e9

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  build:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools_scm
  run:
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - smatch
    - amr

about:
  home: https://github.com/snowblink14/smatch
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Smatch (semantic match) tool

  description: |
    Smatch is an evaluation tool for AMR (Abstract Meaning Representation). It
    computes the Smatch score (defined below) of two AMR graphs in terms of
    their matching triples (edges) by finding a variable (node) mapping that
    maximizes the count, M, of matching triples


extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - hmaarrfk
